content.description: Sit start on the jugs at base of boulder. Climb out of roof to good holds, then go for top out. This route doesn't let up!Beta Video
content.location: In the boulder field just past too pumped chump.

content.description: This route climbs an initial slab before passing some questionable rock.  Then continue out a roof and up a great handcrack.  The last part of the route continues up and left to a slot.
content.protection: Nothing fixed...light trad rack...build an anchor on the top of the formation...long slings are very helpful.
content.location: Located on The Flintstone...down past the Holiday Block and the Islands...valley side...left most route...look for the hand crack out a roof.

content.description: A short but fun and pumpy sport climb.  Follow the steep fin/arete up and left to anchors at the top.
content.location: Starts next to a campsite on the side facing away from the valley, at a prominent fin/arete.  Lower from the anchors.

content.description: Fred serves up some double brontosaurus-sized roof action after the initial 1 bolt protected slab.  Climb slab to a ledge then work your way up and over one roof (look for the handle bar), up and over a second roof (powerful) before finishing off this man-sized meal.
content.protection: One bolt down low, Anchors on top, light trad rack, long slings.
content.location: Located on The Flintstone...down past the Holiday Block and the Islands...valley side...middle route on the formation...look for a black spot on a roof above a slab start.

content.description: This is the last large formation, past The Islands,  to the south as you leave the parking lot at Sandrock.  Routes are located on the valley facing side and are around 50-60 feet in height.  Some of the classic trad routes have, unfortunately, been retro-bolted.
